Package nzilbb.ag.serialize

Interface GraphSerializer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISerializer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JSONSerialization
    public interface GraphSerializer
    Interface for serializing a graph to streams of data.

    Serialization takes place in the following phases:

    1. Configure serializer using configure(ParameterSet,Schema)
    2. Determine which (if any) layers are required for the serialization by calling getRequiredLayers(), which returns a list of layer IDs.
    3. Serialize the graph using serialize(Spliterator,String[],Consumer,Consumer,Consumer)
    4. Possibly display or log warnings consumed during serialize() by serialize(Spliterator,String[],Consumer,Consumer,Consumer)
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptor

        SerializationDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Returns the deserializer's descriptor
        Returns:
        The deserializer's descriptor

      • configure

        ParameterSet configure​(ParameterSet configuration,
                       Schema schema)
        Sets parameters for serializer as a whole. This might include database connection parameters, locations of supporting files, standard layer mappings, etc.

        When the serializer is installed, this method should be invoked with an empty parameter set, to discover what (if any) general configuration is required. If parameters are returned, and user interaction is possible, then the user may be presented with an interface for setting/confirming these parameters. This always returns the required parameters, whether or not they are fulfilled.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The general configuration for the serializer.
        schema - The layer schema, definining layers and the way they interrelate.
        Returns:
        A list of configuration parameters (still) must be set before getRequiredLayers() can be called. If this is an empty list, getRequiredLayers() can be called. If it's not an empty list, this method must be invoked again with the returned parameters' values set.

      • getRequiredLayers

        String[] getRequiredLayers()
                    throws SerializationParametersMissingException
        Determines which layers, if any, must be present in the graph that will be serialized.
        Returns:
        A list of IDs of layers that must be present in the graph that will be serialized.
        Throws:
        SerializationParametersMissingException - If not all required parameters have a value.

      • getCardinality

        default GraphSerializer.Cardinality getCardinality()
        Determines the cardinality between graphs and serialized streams.

        This can be useful to know when deciding, for example, whether a given serialization with produce a single stream that can be returned directly, vs. multiple streams that should be zipped into a single stream result.

        The default implementation returns NtoM, override for other values.

        Returns:
        The cardinality between graphs and serialized streams.

      • serialize

        void serialize​(Spliterator<Graph> graphs,
               String[] layerIds,
               Consumer<NamedStream> consumer,
               Consumer<String> warnings,
               Consumer<SerializationException> errors)
        throws SerializerNotConfiguredException
        Serializes the given series of graphs, generating one or more NamedStreams.

        Many data formats will only yield one stream per graph (e.g. Transcriber transcript or Praat textgrid), however there are formats that use multiple files for the same transcript (e.g. XWaves, EmuR), and others still that will produce one stream from many Graphs (e.g. CSV).

        The method is synchronous in the sense that it should not return until all graphs have been serialized.

        Parameters:
        graphs - The graphs to serialize.
        layerIds - The IDs of the layers to include, or null for all layers.
        consumer - The consumer receiving the streams.
        warnings - A consumer for (non-fatal) warning messages.
        errors - A consumer for (fatal) error messages.
        Throws:
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - if the object has not been configured.

      • getPercentComplete

        Integer getPercentComplete()
        Determines how far through the serialization is.
        Returns:
        An integer between 0 and 100 (inclusive), or null if progress can not be calculated.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel the serialization in course (if any).
